content: the **bi the way scarf** was inspired by the bisexual flag and its beautiful colors - blue purple and pink - to show pride in a sexual orientation that is too often ignored erased and mistreated makers are of course welcome to make this scarf in any colors they wish though selecting to wear colors that show one s pride is the ultimate goal of the design the scarf would look fabulous in any tri-colored pride flag color scheme > enjoy the **bi the way scarf** pattern > for free in celebration of bi pride > as well as the larger lgbtqia+ pride > month > in lieu of payment for > a pattern consider donating to any/all of > the causes linked below > > ** the trevor project 1 hrc - human rights campaign 2 lambda > legal 3 ** > > the sample for this pattern was made > with anzula yarns cricket dk a lovely > luxury dk weight yarn that comes in > beautiful colors anzula yarns is > currently running a fundraiser - > please consider donating to this yarn > brand so they can keep making gorgeous > yarns for the greater knitting > community > > ** anzula needs your help - fundraiser by kalliope famellos 4 ** **construction** this scarf is knit lengthwise beginning with a long cast on for the entire length s edge garter stitch frames a slanted lace pattern around all sides - the cast on bind off left and right edges simple increases decreases and yarn overs work together to make the slanted lace pattern creating mesh fabric as the scarf is knit lengthwise three vertical color stripes are made with simple color changes the pattern s length and width are easily adjustable **size** one size = 80 long x 12 wide / 203 cm long x 30 5 cm wide after blocking **gauge** 15 sts x 32 row = 4 /10 cm in slanted lace pattern worked flat after blocking see construction section for notes regarding gauge **yarn** 3 skeins total of anzula luxury fibers cricket dk 250 yards / 228 meters 114g / 4 oz 80% superwash merino wool 10% cashmere 10% nylon or any dk weight yarn that obtains gauge **colorways** color a lapis color b prudence color c ballerina **estimated yards/meters** colors a and c = 212 yards / 194 meters each color b = 195 yards / 178 meters 619 yards / 566 meters total **needles** us size 7 4 5 mm 60 /152 5 cm circular needles **other materials** darning needle scissors blocking mats and pins please come ask questions share in-progress or fo photos or participate in my test knits in the juliana lustenader designs group 5 1 https //www thetrevorproject org/fundraise/ 2 https //www hrc org/ 3 https //lambdalegal org/ 4 https //www spotfund com/story/241f90ae-1861-48c1-9bd8-30919acf7ca8 5 https //www ravelry com/groups/juliana-lustenader-designs
